website_summaries.verdict: It's like creating a marble run with logic. Great fun for kids and parents to enjoy together.
pros: Using cards and blocks, you have to get your marble through to the target tower
cons: Nature of the game makes it nearly impossible for someone who is color blind

website_summaries.verdict: Not your average marble run toy. This highly educational game is perfect for parents and kids looking for a bit of extra mental stimulation.
pros: Challenges visual perception and reasoning skills
cons: Challenge cards not compliant for colorblind users

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toy for an only child whose parents can't entertain ...
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son is obsessed with this game. He loves figuring out each maze. It makes him use problem solving skills and logic. This is a great toy for an only child whose parents can't entertain the child every minute. He choses this over video games! Now that is saying something.
customer_reviews.author: Amy P.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this toy--it is fun.
customer_reviews.text: 4th graders and engineers love this toy. Follow the cards, create your own, make it big, make it long--it's all fun. It is the most sought after game in my classroom and it engaged two very serious young adults until they were told to put it away.
customer_reviews.author: K. Finley

customer_reviews.title: but had a good time doing it
customer_reviews.text: My 14-year-old son solved all the puzzles in about an hour, but had a good time doing it. Afterwards, he began creating his own "expert" level challenges and drawing them out. The pieces are a little tight, but that's necessary to ensure the marble moves as it's supposed to...just makes it a little cumbersome to reconfigure. Definitely a brain teaser and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Fascinating for kids and grownups!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for my grandsons, who liked it and began playing with it the minute they opened it, but it was just as intriguing for our sons, their dad and uncle!
customer_reviews.author: S. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Fun game, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great game but once a person figures out the basics the solutions/patterns become fairly easy to spot. They also make a laser maze which is also a lot of fun but even easier to figure out. This is a step up since the laser maze is 2D and this is 3D. The more challenging levels are not radically more challenging, however. Kids love it and I am happy they are digging an educational game (just don't tell them that ;-) All-in-all a very good game and happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Miles B. Free

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This toy was not as fun as I had hoped it would be. I bought it for my 8 year old for Christmas. It takes great patience to figure out how to get the marbles through the maze you have to make. Once you do figure it out, it takes two seconds for the marble to go through. Frustrating, and boring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to teach problem solving and critical thinking skills.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my therapy sessions with children to help increase executive functioning skills, specifically problem solving and critical thinking. It has 4 levels and starts at the very basic level which gradually increases difficulty in order for the individual to become comfortable with the technique. Also great for adults who like chess but do not have a partner. I relate it a lot to chess as you have to predict several moves/positions ahead of time, to visually picture the layout in order to win. I highly recommend this as not only a 1-person game but as a teaching tool as well.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Jurgs

customer_reviews.title: Gravity Maze Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: This is a great brain exerciser for everyone, old and young alike. It's a nice size for a desk and certainly an attention getter by its appearance. Think Fun products are well made and the Gravity Maze is a great example of that. The towers are colorful, precision built,and interesting to look at. The base has rubber non-slip pads for great traction and holds motionless while snapping the game pieces in place and when the bearing is rolling through them. The difficulty progresses at a comfortable level and it's fun watching the ball bearing travel downward through the game pieces in the hopes of making it all the way to the goal, the red box. Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jack McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Difficult and unrewarding
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for an 8 year old and he was bored with it within minutes. Although the colorful plastic cubes look great, the metal ball they provide is too heavy and falls through the maze so fast it's not worth the effort to make one. I'm 60 years old and rebuild motorcycle engines, yet I found making the mazes difficult and again, not worth the effort. The kid was like 'so what?' when I showed him the metal ball race 4 inches from the top to the bottom of my 1 turn 'maze'. I felt bad for the kid and told him I'd get him another gift. UGH!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant game
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect when I purchased this game for my 12-year-old son. He enjoys science in the experiments so I thought I would try it. This game did not disappoint. The beginning cards are quite easy but once you start going through the deck of cards moving up in difficulty they become increasingly hard to figure out even for adults. It will definitely get everyone in the family working together !
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Great game but challenging
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for Christmas. I got it because his sister had the Rush Hour Traffic Jam game and he loved solving the puzzles. This game however he hasnt really played it too much. Not really interested at this time. In any case, the little time he has played with it has been challenging. I think this is another reason he hasnt played with it much. It does take some to to get used to the idea that you have to position them a certain way to get the beam to go all the way though. He likes it though.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly S.

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, you can get more puzzles online
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old solved all of them enclosed puzzles in less than an hour. Fortunately, you can get more puzzles online!!
customer_reviews.author: Julinoe

customer_reviews.title: Small marble maze
customer_reviews.text: This product is quite small. It takes a little while to figure out how it works, but once you crack the code, so to speak, it makes sense to kids and adults. My grandkids, from age 7 to 13, were mildly interested. They solved some of the challenges without looking, and used the solution for other builds, but it was so small and the marble run is over almost as soon as it starts so it wasn't an activity they wanted to return to. This might be fun as a competitive game in a group or school setting, but it wasn't a big hit with my grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: L. V.

customer_reviews.title: Not a complete set! So unhappy
customer_reviews.text: So unhappy, because our game hasn’t got the target tower( the red one). We bought this game on the advice of my friends last year, but my daughter was 6 years old, so we gave it to her only now. what was our disappointmant when we unpacked the game and there is no main red part at all, just an empty place. I don’t understand how you can sell a product like this without checking its completeness? So unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Not as engaging long-term as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for his 9th birthday. Immediately upon opening it, he spent nearly two hours playing with it--which was great, except that in that time, he managed to do 40 of the 60 challenges and apparently exhausted his interest. The Easy challenges he solved instantly, and the Intermediate ones took minimal thought. In the year since then, he's barely touched it. On the plus side, his younger siblings have found it to be a bit more challenging and have occasionally spent time either doing the challenges or experimenting to create their own laser mazes, so it wasn't a complete loss.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdy Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of my son always wanting to play video games or his tablet. He said he's interested in becoming a video game designer. Gravity Maze came up as recommended for those interested in coding. My son immediately took to this game and brought it out each day after school for a few weeks. It's still a go to during downtime. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: The Missing Bronte

customer_reviews.title: Kept a smart 8 yr old busy for a very long time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 yr old Grandson who was staying with me for a couple days during the summer and since we were in lock down and could not go anywhere I ordered this. He is very smart and I wanted to challenge him. He was very smug at first because the first few were very easy. Bwahahha they keep getting harder and harder. I dont remember how many he got through but he really enjoyed playing with it and takes it out frequently when he comes over. Nice change of pace from video games.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well, but the pieces do not fit into ...
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well, but the pieces do not fit into the board well and tend to pop out. We have also noticed that all the pieces have to be perfectly in place or the lights do not light up. This gets frustrating when you can't seem to figure out a puzzle only to find out you did figure it out, it is just the contact points on the blocks not connecting the light to the battery supply. Still a very cool concept and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Used item
customer_reviews.text: This $30 game was definitely a return, the box states batteries not included, they are used and badly leaking acid, game was in complete disarray, the sent me a returned used item, this was a gift!!! Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: AZdkc

customer_reviews.title: Fun and interesting
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old and his friends love to get this game out. Its challenging for them but fun. I love that its a game but it is sneaky puzzle and engineering practice at the same time. I enjoy playing it with my son as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: Very Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this to be larger than it was when it arrived the image gives me that impression, having said that, my grandson seems to enjoy it a lot. He's 9 years old and finds it very entertaining. If you like puzzles or figuring things out you might want to give this item a try. In his words, "it's stimulating." I myself haven't tried it out but he seems to approve.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly George

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Challenging.  Great gift.
customer_reviews.text: Oh boy, this has been a hit. When asked what her favorite Xmas present was, my 10-year-old daughter has repeatedly said "Gravity Maze" and proceeded to explain the game and how cool it is. The game was easy to set up, easy to figure out how to play, and then it becomes progressively more challenging as you move from beginning to intermediate levels of difficulty. The pieces fit easily back into their compartments in the box for storage. It would be neat to figure out a way to make it a dual-player game, either collaborative or competitive.
customer_reviews.author: Mamma Ro

customer_reviews.title: You have to be patient.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a really good game. The higher levels can be challenging so challenging you might be surprised, but you might get frustrated when the dominos fall over trying to set them up. It does require an amount of patience. Otherwise a GREAT game. Thank you Thinkfun!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stir-crazy

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional toy with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: This game provides stem skills and challenging fun. The 60 challenge cards add to the fun, with increasing difficulty. Every successful combination is rewarding as you watch the three marbles drop to the final cube. Having said that, I was quite disappointed with the grid provided. It is much too flimsy to construct the mazes without one or more of the towers popping out while construction is underway. This can be quite frustrating and shortens the attention span of my grandson when we play.
customer_reviews.author: M Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: So disspointed with this "game." Just get regular dominos and use your imagination.
customer_reviews.text: My son was SO excited to see this game. We opened it up and started playing. Within 15 minutes the game was back in the box and put away in the closet. Why? Because the game just does not work well. First issue the dominos are weak. They have no heft to them. What this means is it will NOT go up the stairs. It hits the first one and it stops. The "spinner" things looked really cool, but often they do not work. Don't waste your time or money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Stickman

customer_reviews.title: Trying to fight brain fog!
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to find things for my Autistic child to do. We have just discovered that he is amazing at building Legos. So, I bought this in hopes that he would use it and strengthen his most important part of his body, his brain. He stayed up almost all night the first night just trying to get through the 1st level. I do believe it kept his attention, and I believe it will be something he will continue to use for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal McCullough

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Have made it almost through the advanced level with my 7-year-old; it is easily clear why this has won so many awards. It's really intuitive, the directions are clear, and the actual construction of the toy is good quality. Absolutely love it, we work on a few each day and I am sure we'll forget the answers by the time we cycle back around to the beginner ones again. Very satisfying to solve the puzzles, great game.
customer_reviews.author: P. S. Bose

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, lacks creativity
customer_reviews.text: My 7 & 8 year old loved this game... for 10 mins. I was excited about buying this game for them until we opened it and realized there just wasn't much to it. It's the same simple concept over and over and over again. This could've been a great game had it incorporated a little more substance to it, but it's simple just pointing a laser back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Cool game but gets old quick
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 5 year old son who loves any puzzle game. The pieces are sturdy and it comes with 3 marbles. We had lots of fun with this one, went through all the cards in about an hour. After a few days of playing with it and doing all the possible tracks we could, my son was through with it and ready for another game. Once you've completed all the tracks for the cards, starting over makes no difference because it's the same thing over and over. He now uses this as a middle piece add on in his home made marble track that goes around his room.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Green

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable fun and challenging
customer_reviews.text: One of THE best toys I’ve ever purchased for my 8year old daughter. This is next level fun. If your kid loves (likes) challenging games and loves hitting their brain like mine lol, while having fun this is a MUST. We been having so much fun with this, it’s very simple yet it can be super challenging. Pieces are durability l, light and it’s a great brain challenge gain. We love it so much that I’m buying bunch more to gift to the future scientists and brainiacs 👍
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Innovative
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old grandson couldn't have been happier, and he played with it for hours when I gave it to him. He kept saying how awesome it was. The colors are beautiful and vibrant. The plastic material the pieces are made from are of very strong and good quality. Will continue to give him hours of fun as there are several different puzzles to build. It really makes you think and use your common sense.
customer_reviews.author: barb939

customer_reviews.title: I like it, kids ignore it.
customer_reviews.text: At 53 i thought this a good gift option vs electronic crap for my 9 year old kids... I was wrong.. Much as i try they have no interest. It is a very clever game.
customer_reviews.author: stepheno

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game!
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty bad at spatial skills and I wanted to work on them with this game. This game is amazing! It is super hard (for me) which is kind of the point. It takes a while to learn how all the pieces work and how to play the game, so it helped me to practice using them first for a while as the game suggested. It is super fun and great for older kids and adults. I love the creativity put into it and how satisfying it is when everything works right! But this game if you want to practice spatial skills and have fun :)
customer_reviews.author: BHChieftain

customer_reviews.title: Spend a bit more and get something better than this.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but very poor quality. Pieces pop out and don't fit tightly. Switch and bridge pieces seem too big and have to be held in place to make contact and not pop out. There are far better quality toys out there to teach these concepts that are worth the extra money you'll spend. Very disappointing for ThinkFun.
customer_reviews.author: hlk

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong two months later
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over Christmas for my 7yo nephew and he was thrilled, immediately started the various challenges. We thought it would be just another short lived toy in his closet that would be hidden under boxes of legos and other brainy games he likes. We are heading into March now and it’s still going strong! In fact he’s on a trip to SD right now to visit LEGOland and brought this game along over any of the other toys he just got for his birthday two weeks ago! That in itself speaks volumes of how this game does a good job of keeping this kid happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kulkarni

customer_reviews.title: great game/puzzle - highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews often, but we just got this yesterday and my 7-year-old son LOVES IT. It has pulled him away from video games and LEGO and everything else. He wanted to stay up way past his bedtime to "play" with this. Before we opened it, I told him it was for learning, and he groaned. I told him learning can be fun. He didn't believe me. I think he believes me, now. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Wangler

customer_reviews.title: Challenging STEM
customer_reviews.text: Rec'd as part of Amazon S.T.E.A.M. subscription. Kiddo 6yo, but ordered 8+ level since he has most of the sets that come with 6yo subscription or we've already done the same things in other ways. He's worked thru 6 of the challenges, which really (to me) go from super-basic to more challenging pretty quickly. Took him about 30 min on card 6 to figure it out, and that was with papa's help. Something he can grow with. Even though it's very challenging, he still wants to try and is even experimenting with his own laser paths, which I encourage.
customer_reviews.author: McGaugh

customer_reviews.title: Its a fun little solo game with quick set up
customer_reviews.text: Its a fun little solo game with quick set up. I'm currently at puzzle 53 out of 60. I've gotten about 10 hours out of it so far. The puzzles are pretty easy up into the 30s, but would be a better challenge for younger people (I'm 32). Some puzzles have a few ways to solve them which makes you feel a bit cheated when you go to check your maze and you actually didn't have the right answer but it worked anyway. Probably not much replay-ability once you've completed the puzzles. But a good game for what it is. Solid time waster that makes you think a bit.
customer_reviews.author: owen freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for kids above 7 maybe
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for our kids, and they really liked it; I think it’s just more for older kids like maybe 7+, coz we have it to our kids when they were about 5 and 3, they still liked it, but they don’t get the concept very well.
customer_reviews.author: Inna Furlong

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining educational fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 yo grandson LOVES this game. He’s obsessed with Minecraft so I wanted to find something not video related to catch his attention (tough job!). He’s really good at remembering mazes and levels so I thought this would be a match to use that ability. He’s even making up his own patterns and plays for hours!
customer_reviews.author: E. Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Good brain stimulation
customer_reviews.text: Takes some time to understand the directions. Had to reverse engineer a couple mazes. My "know-it-all" 19yo "too cool to hang out with family" daughter spent a couple hours playing with it....THAT was totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute Toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew's 8th birthday. He really likes them. He's into games and my sister likes him to have educational games. This isn't a compact small space project though. The little pieces do get everywhere but the kids love them. I would recommend the game as long as you watch the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: A favorite gift
customer_reviews.text: This gravity maze was was that drew my 9 year old grandson's attention right from the start. It didn't take him but a minute to figure out what he needed to do to have fun and I liked having him being able to manipulate the blocks to create an actual 3 D maze in front of him instead of something on an iPad! This surely involves a lot of spacial thinking as well as planning. Great for him to use by himself as well.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia A. Melbert

customer_reviews.title: Have fun! Problem solving skills are a must.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 7 yr old for Christmas. Honestly, he wasn't thrilled. He said it looked lame. Ha. I decided to open it and try out the first 2 cards with him watching and that was the end of the lame game. He is now on the intermediate level and we work together some, since it's becoming difficult for him. Nothing negative to say. Highly recommended if you have a smart kid that wants a challenging type of brain game! 😁
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Beaver

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: She had it for about 2 weeks when she told me she's done over half of the maps(?) The laser light is a bit dimmer now and it has odd batteries. So, be sure to buy extras. Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Fun and addictive for all ages
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game for my nephews for Christmas. The only thing that they are interested in is anything with a screen - so I wasn't about to buy them another video game and was determined to find something that they would love. I had played this last summer and remembered it was fun. Anyway, it was a HUGE hit at Christmas. The boys had a blast and I couldn't have been more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Conflicted
customer_reviews.text: The concept of the game is good. However, my students (they are 8 & 9) keep trying to use the laser portion on each others eyes. Maybe it is just my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Williams-Powell

customer_reviews.title: A Hit In My Family
customer_reviews.text: Our 11 yr old son loves this game! He was "bored" with the first few challenges but 1/2 way through the plans, he is constantly stumped and needing to tear down & rebuild. A good lesson in perserverence for sure! A puzzle and a game with a lazer. That is a great recipe for hours of fun for kids (and the parents like to watch too!). Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: HathiTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: If you know someone that likes challenges and hates to lose give them this game. It is fun and makes you think I like that it has different levels and kids 18+ will get addicted to this game.
customer_reviews.author: Vet

customer_reviews.title: Great brain challenging toy.
customer_reviews.text: This was a bday gift to 6yo grandson. He is intellectually gifted and loved this toy, as it was something new to learn. He caught on quickly to the principles and greatly enjoys reading and solving nearly all the puzzles by himself. Daddy helps out with the more challenging ones, and he has fun too! They liked the packaging, neat and tidy way to keep all the pieces together.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Not that much fun.
customer_reviews.text: It just is t that fun. Once you do a few of the mazes it kind of gets boring. Some of the harder ones are too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Dickie Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Requires patience and trial and error
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this "toy" for my kids. It's kind of a toy, but it pushes my kids to try different setups to get the necesary outcome to solve the problem. The first time I tried I got lazy and just looked at the way to solve the puzzle. It helps my 9 year old not to give up and keep trying. My 7 year old likes it too. The fact that the answer isn't straight forward is a welcome change. Helps strengthen attention spans and not just quit quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Hooser

customer_reviews.title: Terrific 3-D puzzle - teaches engineering and programming sklls
customer_reviews.text: Love this company, their traffic game Rush Hour was a great game. This one takes more abstract / 3-D thinking because the ball disappears and you have to plot out how it's going to move through the different chambers. On the advanced expert level the ball weaves in and out of the towers several times. 3 generations can play the same game with different cards and be challenged.
customer_reviews.author: tspia

customer_reviews.title: Great thinking game need better instructions
customer_reviews.text: The game is great was useable right out of the box. The game makes you think and the kids liked it. The only complaint is that they needed better instructions. The picture cards are good but it took a few cards to be able to explain to the kids how to play. The goal and set up wasn't always clear. That said once I explained the play the kids enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Product Review Pro

customer_reviews.title: Get it! You will not regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Having worked as a computer programmer I can confirm that playing this game is very similar. You have to think through the process in your mind. Build out your thoughts in front of you, then compile and run. Your hands are the compiler. The marble is the operating system that succeeds or fails to run if the structure is correct or not. Also the little cubes that route the marble remind me of building old school computers using circuit gates, NAND gates, etc. Also, the kids love to play it. No encouragement is needed. They play it like playing their favorite video game. We keep the game right on the kitchen table. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: John Rap

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Practically... Anti-climactic.
customer_reviews.text: Was not as intricate, or interesting as I thought it would be. Initially, I gifted it to my granddaughter for critical thinking development. Visually it appears very intriguing, and interesting. It appeared as though each cube would be an active block for travel dictation, and would develope physical inertia, momentum, and direction changes, with-in whichever design could be imagined. That was not the case. Towers are pre-assembled, and limit the option for creativity. All in all, it took a seven year old about a half hour to figure out the puzzle system and lose interest.
customer_reviews.author: marc

customer_reviews.title: Fun game that makes you think.
customer_reviews.text: This game was very fun and challenging for my 9 year old. He loved it, played with it for hours, and now his new thing is making up his own gravity drop courses. I love that the answers for the problems are included. But even using some of the problems and solutions from the manual, if the pieces aren't sitting flush, the marble can jump off course. So playing on a completely flat surface and making sure the pieces are well seated would probably prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Shallowpockets

customer_reviews.title: Great fun and challenging! Huge hit at Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: This game was a HUGE hit for my 13yr old grandson last Christmas. He’s a gifted young man so I wondered if it would be a challenge. He couldn’t stop playing with it, trying to get to each new and more difficult level and was surprised to get stumped. LOL. His 17yr old brother even jumped in for the fun. I was so happy to find a game for my grandson that was NOT on his computer or phone. Board games are still the BEST for your family!
customer_reviews.author: B. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandsons, but everyone loves it, even Grandma! It's recommended for ages 8 & up, but my 7-year old grandson is up to the challenge. His 4-year old brother enjoys playing with the pieces and making his own mazes. Teaches problem solving with an emphasis on logical thought processes. I would enjoy an even larger version! Highly recommend - this is one of the best puzzle items I've bought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not really work well.
customer_reviews.text: The basis of the game is to build a maze that will route the marble from a specified start to finish position. Neat concept, but the parts do not fit together very well and the marble would often hang or overshoot (even when properly setup). My 8 year old grandson was very frustrated and he is an accomplished Lego assembler. I am afraid this is a game that will stay on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: S. Doradus

customer_reviews.title: A-maze-ing Game and BOTH my kids love it
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing! It's a hit with both my kids and I love how it makes them think without them realizing it. They were both cheering and laughing the first time we played. My younger child (7) does occasionally ask for help and I usually don't comply, because kid CAN figure it out, she just has to think a little harder, but when she then figures out how to solve it, she's more excited about her earned "win." I highly recommend this game to parents and teachers.
customer_reviews.author: genealochick79

customer_reviews.title: Thinking, Planning and Fun
customer_reviews.text: This requires hands on, thinking and strategy planning. If your child likes to plan and see what happens after implementing the strategy, hours could be spent playing with the toys. If your child spends a lot of time on digital devices, it will take a while to wean them off and then have he or she become interested in this set.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect puzzle for the mind
customer_reviews.text: My 7yrs old loves this. Had it on a Christmas wishlist for her last yr. I had to return it because there was a piece missing. It was a manufacture defect. Ordered another one after the return and it was complete. Definitely was worth the wait because my daughter loves it. Perfect puzzle to make kids scratch their heads. My daughter also brainstorms her own layout to solve a part from doing it with the cards.
customer_reviews.author: Saints

customer_reviews.title: Return
customer_reviews.text: The lazer is not focused on the center. Can not solve with this. Return plz.
customer_reviews.author: HY

customer_reviews.title: Fun domino puzzles
customer_reviews.text: My family enjoys this game. We like it because it is quick to learn & play. The challenges are great. My youngest child, age 9, likes to make up his own puzzles rather than using the cards.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Razo

customer_reviews.title: Great idea for a child into STEM, not so great quality product
customer_reviews.text: My son was super excited when he got this as a gift. The puzzle aspect and problems solving skill development is well executed. The actual circuit connections are not always dependable and have a tendency to come loose. A few times he got the right solution to a challenge, but then we had to squeeze the pieces together very hard to get the lights to respond.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids even younger than Eight
customer_reviews.text: I use Gravity Maze and Circuit Maze with my grandkids who are four and five. They love it. We copy the solutions side which gives then training on reading drawings. They have to find the right place on a grid to place the power source and then follow the path, turning all the pieces to the proper orientation, looking for the + and - (attention to detail). When they place the terminal and it all lights up they are so pleased with themselves. I have them then trace the flow of electricity with their finger all the way back to the power source to make a closed circuit.
customer_reviews.author: J3

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: It’s really a great smart game my daughters love it and it arrives in just five working days by global amazon ☺️❤️
customer_reviews.author: hudhud

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: WE LOVE THIS GAME, we even play it after the kids go to bed. I hope for expansion packs soon. My only complaint it that a few of the cards and piece positions are a little difficult to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Both adults and kids like playing it. I play it with my 10 year old, it's challenging, non-ordinary, well-designed, has levels from easy to advanced, which make it easy to learn new strategies of this game. We like taking it our for our guests. You can play it alone or arrange a competition or a team challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Yuliya

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids who love to build!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this, and it really puts his mind to work. He will spend hours trying to solve the mazes. The age recommendation is 8+ but my son is 7. He struggles on some of the tougher puzzles, but does just fine on the others. I highly recommend this marble maze for anyone with children who like to solve puzzles, or build Legos.
customer_reviews.author: 4Ships

customer_reviews.title: It’s an amazing game to play alone that challenges kids to think!
customer_reviews.text: It’s an amazing game for kids to play alone!!! My kid absolutely loved this game. It was easy to understand the rules, and in a few minutes he was already playing with it. The beginners cards are extremely easy, I hope that they get more difficult, so that he is challenged. The only negative part is that sometimes the pieces fall even when they are positioned in the correct place. But that is a minor thing. My kid was entertained for a long period and left the video games aside. I hope the creators provide more cards in the future so that the kids and adults can continue to be challenged!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart, Entertaining "Game"
customer_reviews.text: I have a seven year old, highly gifted child who absolutely loves this challenging puzzler. Only problem is, he has conquered all levels - Basic, Intermediate and Expert. He is now designing his own mazes. I hope the creators of this very cool game are working on Level Two for the kids who get through this one. Btw...we recommend this brain building exercise highly!
customer_reviews.author: Glen D. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: 7 year old - still playing with it after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Fun to play.. seems fairly fragile.. luckily we've not dropped any of the plastic tubes on to any hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect instructions make this not a solo toy
customer_reviews.text: The game is cute enough, unfortunately the cards show the towers oriented backwards. An adult needs to read the solution to ensue that the puzzle is possible before passing it off. My daughter is on puzzle #6 as I write this. 4 of the first 5 were impossible without changing the starting setup.
customer_reviews.author: D. McAloon

customer_reviews.title: Bad Circuit Connections
customer_reviews.text: There are bad circuit connections so the lights don't come on 1/2 the time (yes, I've checked if my child did the circuit right). Too bad because the idea of this game is great. Very disappointing... By the way, I'm an electrical engineer.
customer_reviews.author: Lige Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great game - while it says 8+ year old
customer_reviews.text: Great game - while it says 8+ year old, we tried with our 6 year old. IT is a little bit challenging and definitely needs some help from us. But once he got the hang of it, was really fun - highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: samurai2011

customer_reviews.title: Worst gift idea ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a kids really into stem. The stacks of whatever they are supposed to be wouldn't even stay in place. I am so embarrassed. What a terrible toy and gift. Made me look like an idiot bc I thought this had looked so good. DO NOT BE FOOLED BY THE 5 STAR REVIEWS -
customer_reviews.author: TM44

customer_reviews.title: My ten year old loves this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old niece. She loves it. She is a bookworm, but I wanted to make sure she has some spatial-logic skills as well. She's not much of an athlete, but she loves to challenge herself. This game is perfect because she can play alone or ask others for help in playing along with her. She's been really into it, and it pulls her away from the tablet for a little while, at least.
customer_reviews.author: lan811

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game that really makes the kids think
customer_reviews.text: We have had the laser maze jr. For a couple of years, and my kids love this. It's a game that really makes them think and learn although they don't know they're learning. So we decided to buy the older kid version for a birthday present.I think I'm going to go ahead and order this for ourselves also now that they're starting to outgrow the junior version
customer_reviews.author: L. Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Great puzzle!
customer_reviews.text: My seven year old daughter LOVES this puzzle/game. After showing her how to read the cards, she was off and spent hours playing with this. It built her confidence to solve problems and think through solutions. I thought it was pricey but it is well worth the cost. It is well made and brings lots of screen free entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Super and Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old daughter enjoys playing with this and Dad is near to help or take a turn. It is nice if an older person may help, especially when playing for the first time. This is a nice together maze to solve or take turns solving the maze of each card. My daughter is doing very well at solving the mazes and really enjoys this!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey B.

customer_reviews.title: Creative and Fun
customer_reviews.text: My students love to solve the puzzles in this logic game. It holds their attention and creates a chance for them to talk together as they think of ways to move the marble through the maze. The pieces are colorful and made to last. Every classroom should have games like this to provide engineering activities for students. I will definitely buy more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer41

customer_reviews.title: My 8 year old son LOVED
customer_reviews.text: My son is 8 and he absolutely LOVED this Marble Maze! He is able to make his own mazes. I'd say he probably spent a good hour and a half playing with it. I'd recommend especially for an educational but fun game. You have to use strategy, but to my son he was just having fun. The tray had rubber feet on it and the pieces seem pretty sturdy...my son is rough on everything and they are holding up well as much as he's played with it.....
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: We love this
customer_reviews.text: My son had been asking for this since he saw it on a website he follows. I had to get it for his 8th birthday. He enjoys this so much ! It’s easy enough for him and keeps him entertained for hours. He also actually takes great care of it and places it away after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda K

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of box
customer_reviews.text: Yellow light did not work straight out of the box and the peices dont always fit well. And after a half hour of play...the red light doesnt work. A piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Thinking Game
customer_reviews.text: 6 yr old son loved this. He's into thinking games and the "laser" light makes it all the more fun. It's just an intense red light, I think, not a real laser. Son can focus well on thinking challenges and also likes Rush Hour and Robot Turtles games. Dad plays with son as I am not into (and no good at) logic games or chess or programming. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Pround and Happy Mama

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Sons are 10 and 12. Both have autism, older one a bit more so than the younger. We're always looking for games to get those minds thinking for family game night. This is a good one. My nephews like it too. Seems to be a hit all the way around. Would give as gift again.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Kylean

customer_reviews.title: So far the best game we have bought!!
customer_reviews.text: We just got this in the mail today and my son has been playing it non stop!!!! He is almost 8 years old and he is usually not impressed with many toys/games but is by far the most excited I’ve seen him with a game! Highly recommend this for ages 6+
customer_reviews.author: Bruna

customer_reviews.title: Fun and challenging. My boy (6) has been  playing with it the moment the box was opened.
customer_reviews.text: This is little advance for a 6 year old, but he's having fun and learning it at the same time. Probably better for 10 and up, however I think with some parental help young kids will still find it interesting. The deck of cards is arranged from beginner to advanced so it should appeal to a wide range of years and intellect.
customer_reviews.author: Stickman

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Challenging
customer_reviews.text: My six year old grandson loves this and went from Challenge 1 to 9 on the first day. It’s good because it’s a one-person game and because it’s not too easy or boring. I would recommend it for kids who like to build and solve problems.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: A new family favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Speaking from someone who loves the game 'Rush Hour', this is right up in line with it. Took this to family Christmas, and we stayed up way too late playing this game as it became very addicting! At first I thought it was easy and thought I was fixing to be disappointed, but then it became challenging. New favorite game!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy playing this game with the kids and adults in my family. It is a game that challenges you to think as you complete each challenge. You will have such a feeling of accomplishment that it will fuel you to do another one! As with most games, it can get pretty competitive! Definitely add this game to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful before use
customer_reviews.text: Well, I have a Stem membership and this month Amazon sent me this box. Using lasee is very dangerous for kids. I am sure Amazon doesn’t know every year how many cases physicans see for laser burn on eyes. We dropped the box into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: melly

customer_reviews.title: Limited challenge
customer_reviews.text: My boys ages 8 and 10 love to play with this. But within 5 days of receiving it they have already raced through all of the challenges without much difficulty. Although they still enjoy doing the challenges again its not going to be a long lasting activity, particularly for nearly $30. Also we expected that the final block would light up when the challenge is completed having watched the video, but it does not light up, the marble just lands in the final block.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Lee

customer_reviews.title: Everybody LOVES this TOY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun for all ages! Bought for younger nephew but my 20+ year old kids were all over it. Great logic and problem solving toy.
customer_reviews.author: texasbooks

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Fun, Educational
customer_reviews.text: This is a great solitary game for learning the basics of how circuits work. The pieces are sturdy and the box is well organized. My 5 and 8 year olds both enjoy playing this game. The 5 year old needs my help, but the 8 year old plays independently.
customer_reviews.author: Everyday Sensory Mom

customer_reviews.title: GET IT!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the best game ever for our kids (5-9) and ourselves! I absolutely love this game! I also love the fact that it’s not a competition, in which my kids usually fight! It keeps your brain sharp letting one person go at a time. Best family game we have ever had at our house!
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Fox

customer_reviews.title: very nice game
customer_reviews.text: makes you think quite a bit. enjoyable for any age group. 5yo nephew was not patient enough at the beginning. but it was still useful to help him slow down and think. the pieces are transparent and are already showing some small cracks, after one week of usage. wish it was more sturdy and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ramkumar

customer_reviews.title: missing parts,does not look like the photos in the description
customer_reviews.text: There were several pieces missing from the set including the grid to set up. The parts were smaller than the description described. Will never order again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ThinkFun Gravity Maze Marble Run Brain Game and STEM Toy for Boys and Girls Age 8 and Up – Toy of the Year Award Winner
product_meta.description: Style:Gravity MazeGravity Maze is one of ThinkFun's most popular stem toys for boys and girls, and was a Toy of the Year Award winner in 2017, in the Specialty Category. It's a gravity powered maze game that comes with 60 challenges of increasing difficulty, from beginner to expert, and makes a great birthday or holiday present for kids who like puzzles, smart games and challenging activities. Gravity Maze is made with high quality components, and comes with a very clear and easy to understand instruction manual - you'll be able to play within minutes of opening the box. Like all of ThinkFun's games, Gravity Maze has an educational aspect - it's built to develop critical thinking skills and tie into STEM subjects like science and engineering. Playing through the increasingly difficult brain teaser style challenges will sharpen your mind by improving logical reasoning, spatial reasoning and planning skills, all through fun gameplay. Like all of ThinkFun's games, it also makes a wonderful addition to any homeschool curriculum.
feature_bullets: Trusted by Families Worldwide - With over 50 million sold, ThinkFun is the world's leading manufacturer of brain games and mind challenging puzzles

Develops critical skills – Playing your way through the challenges builds spatial reasoning and planning skills, and is partly an engineering and building toy that provides a great stealth learning experience for young players

What you get – Gravity Maze is a combination logic game, marble run, and STEM toy that's one of the best gifts you can buy for boys and girls age 8 and up It contains 60 challenges from beginner to expert, a game grid, 9 towers, 1 target piece, and 3 marbles
Clear instructions – Easy to learn with a clear, high quality instruction manual You can start playing and solving right away
Comes with multi-level challenges - Gravity Maze comes with 60 beginner to expert challenges that become increasingly difficult as you play through them

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
